title: [K-12] Problem-Based Mobile Microlearning Course for Enhancing Higher-Order Thinking Skills (HOTS)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding foundational social science concepts and basic smartphone usage skills
context.additional_context: Conducted in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment, this course prioritizes developing higher-order thinking skills needed to solve real-world social problems.

learning_goals: Learners enhance critical thinking skills to analyze complex social issues and derive core concepts.
Learners can propose creative solutions to real-world social problems by applying the PBL (Problem-Based Learning) approach.

Learners can form teams of three peers on a mobile learning platform (Google Classroom, Padlet, etc.) and complete a 2-week social issue resolution project (e.g., local environmental issues), submitting results that meet four or more of the five collaboration checklist items (communication, role distribution, idea contribution).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
